availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Maysville, Kentucky, merchant. London, England native. Son of John Cox and Mary Cowell Cox. Married to Ann Hopkinson Cox on April 10, 1819. Father of William H. Cox, Lissant Cox, Lucy M. Cox, Joseph H. Cox, Horatio M. Cox, and Albert G. Cox. Merchant in Maysville in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Maysville in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 32A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, p. 41.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville, Ward 2, p. 26.
Biographical Cyclopedia of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Embracing Biographies of Many of the Prominent Men and Families of the State (Chicago and Philadelphia: John M. Gresham Company, 1896), 85-86.
Find A Grave, "George Cox (1791-1881)," Memorial #23699873, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23699873# (accessed December 16, 2018).
